titleStmt.title: James E. Temple to James W. Tate
CWG7854

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Memphis Tenn
Decbr 20th 1862
Jas W Tate Asst Secretary State of Kentucky
Dear Sir

I am this morning placed in receipt of your esteemed favor of the 12th Inst advising me that my appointment as Commissioner of Deeds of the State of Kentucky for the state of Tennessee resident in the city of Memphis will expire on the 7th of Febry 1863 and desiring to know whether I wished a renewal to which I hasten to reply I wish to have my commission renewed and will avail myself of the earliest possible opportunity to enclose you the fee of Five Dollars the tax required upon commissions. You will please inform me -- what sort of money will the fee be required to be paid in whether in Tennessee Kentucky or in United States Treasury notes. My testimonials of character and competency for the office which were furnished at the time I was appointed commissioner are on file in your office and to which I refer you. Your attention
to this will oblige

Yours
Verry Respfly
James E Temple

Tennessee
Comr of Deeds
Jas. E Temple
Memphis
Com Issd Jany 12 1863.
